result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court will set status

Status hearing on June 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:08 AM Call to Order by Court. Appearances stated: Defendant Pa Kou Yang appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Pa Kou Yang.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Richards is heard on status of all cases.  22CF43, 22CF53, 22CF54, 22CF55

22CF53, 22CF54, 22CF55 - Court reviews preliminary questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

22CF53, 22CF54, 22CF55 Atty Richards is heard on all three cases, waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count in each of these cases.  

22CF43 - Atty Richards is heard on Bond Modification. Requests a $1,000.00 cash bond. 
State opposes bond modification.  DA is heard on position. 

22CF43 Court - No bond modification will be made.  Bond remains the same.
Jury status hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

22CF43 Motion Hearing: 
Atty Erickson is heard. Atty Steiner is heard and requests that motion denied. 
Court is heard, bond will remain as $5,000.00 cash bond.


Initial Appearances:
2022CF000053 - Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
2022CF000054 - Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
2022CF000055 - Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 

State is heard on bond. State requests that 1,000.00 cash bond for each of the cases - 22CF53, 22CF54, 22CF55. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court orders for 22CF53, 22CF54, 22CF55 a $1,000.00 signature bond for each of the cases. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. 3:32 PM Call to Order by Court. Appearances stated: Defendant Pa Kou Yang appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Steven G. Richards for Pa Kou Yang appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 

Court reviews preliminary questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Atty Richards is heard and they're prepared to go forward with the arraignment. 
Atty Richards is heard on bond modification. 
Atty Steiner opposes bond modification. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court is heard on bond modification. 
Court orders a bond modification, a $5,000.00 cash bond with the same non monetary conditions. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. No contact with L.Y. and W.G.

Atty Richards is heard.  Defendant stands mute and pleads not guilty to both counts.  Clerk is directed to enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
